comments.body: I think crimson forest are overflowed with stuff and mobs, but i think its good idea, maybe not beeing literaly in nether but having very rare nether Texture for wolf, something like rare Axelotl.

Please add these to the creative menu! You don't understand how hard it is to put commands in when you're playing on Xbox. The keyboard doesn't work with commands well, and if you're playing multiplayer on one device, everyone has to stop what they're doing so you can type the thing.
make size wand so you can change height so a size you set

In the Copper/Tuff Update, they should be adding golems. It just makes sense to add them as either people want them, or they don't care which means everyone is either happy or indifferent! That is a good thing!
I think you should be able to breed them too
Maybe they can give you some effect similar to dolphins do like some night vision for minerals or when fed glow berries he can take you to valuable minerals
this would be really cool, and the improvement aspect would fit w/ the bat overhaul.

Enchantments on armor can still block creaking damage, and the creaking could have a 25% chance to disable a shield.

Maybe to get the old enchantment benefits back, you could craft a trinket with 6 netherite ingots, one piece of raw gold and 2 gunpowder. For the trinket to work, it needs to be held in either your main hand, your offhand or there could be a new trinket slot.

Crafting recipe:

At least these enchantment nerfs are not in Bedrock.

  • However in Bedrock, you don‚Äôt get any knockback protection from Blast Resistance due to a bug: https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MCPE-97054 . That is worse compared to wearing a single piece of armor with Blast protection in Java 1.21 pre-release 4.
this really makes sense. the nerf was really uncalled for, and hardcore minecraft is going to be much harder to survive in the nether, and in big explosive mega projects. revert please

As of right now their are little to no reasons to use these enchantments over protection. Why would reducing their benefits help the game in any way. Please revert this or improve the enchantment in some other way. That or nerf basic protection as to make other protection enchantments valuable.

While it would be interesting to have some kind of "set bonus" mechanic... nerfing existing enchantments to shoehorn it in was not the way to do it.

Respectfully, no thank you.  Please change it back.

No one talks about the PvP community and how many people will love this update but do not give feedback to keep it in place, This should go through as in 1.18 to 1.19.3 majority of the community loved the knockback on blast protection. Many stopped playing the game in general after 1.19.4 and the rest couldn't keep up with the update, I agree that Fire Protection should NOT revert but Blast Protection should to prior 1.19.4. It made things easier and less energy draining. Crystal PvP was at its peak during the old enchantment effect of Blast Protection, The game became boring after the 1.19.4 update and it took almost 75% less skill to be "good"

I may be mistaken about this, but I believe that you are able to now change the code for specific enchantments using data packs. I bet you could steal the files from an older version and upload them to the most recent version. This is tedious of course, but it is doable. Judging by the widespread upset, I am sure that other players will be looking for ways to fix the enchantments too. I bet within a month or so, vanilla tweaks or some other site will come out with a data pack that removes the nerf on Fire and Blast Protection.
This was thankfully reverted in 1.21 release candidate 1.
Re Nerf It
Please

And please make permanent ominous vaults too. I have a huge dungeon crawler mini games themed mega project coming up and I need the ominous vaults with 100% of the ominous vault data available to me for that.

This is a great idea, Bane of Arthropods would become more useful and add to the strategy of the game. Players would be incentivized to use the new splash potions before attacking with a BoA weapon in order to gain increased damage as well as inflict slowness on the target. The bonus of damage and slowness would be balanced out by the extra step of having to brew the potions, devote time to throw one before battle, and to throw accurately. I would have lots of fun using Bane of Arthropods if this feature was implemented
I think that your suggestion in C is an interesting choice. However, I see OP raid farms as a necessity and it would be better not to mess with the technical work done by various groups.

I think th problem is that raid farms can get you more xp and emeralds and totems than you could ever need and the community really wants a nerf to that feature so either this post or what they already have is enough. This way making overpowered farms that instantly pump you into the end game is both harder and the farms themselves take longer to operate correctly.

to the first comment, i think the op raid farms are more than you need. totems are op and emeralds and xp are gainable from villagers. raid farms should be debuffed and villager trades should have a buffed xp yield. that way we don't need the farms anyway

Perhaps they are too much, but my playstyle relies on automation. I may use the most basic AFK raid farm; however, others may need more than that to fuel massive projects. Many in the Minecraft Technical Community enjoy this side of Minecraft. If it were hindered like this, it would make Minecraft sandbox experience less unlimited.
Raid farms are basically an exploit. It makes sense that Mojang is trying to balance out the game.

an upside is that they can be more controlled in exchange for function speed. since you only have to drink a potion, there doesn't have to be as much complicated redstone circuiting that comes with building a farm. you just have to make a spawnable dropshoot and some well placed villagers and the potions do the rest for you, which gets rid of half the circuit and makes you able to control exactly when the raid starts so that you can be prepared to get maximum loot and xp for less hassle each time the farm is activated. also the potion gets rid of the inconvenience of having to accidentally deal with a raid when you pass by a village after raiding and outpost or some loot. it is still easy to make a raid farm. they are just a little slower. plus. if your playstyle is automating the most efficient loot so that you can make mega projects faster, might i suggest villager trading? the blacksmith iron for emerald trade gets you xp levels literally almost on-par with raid farm's efficiency, meaning you can still get your maxed out set fast, without having to inconveniently leave your base as much.

and for the technical side of the community, if they cant make a raid farm that incorporates the new ominous bottles, then i sincerely doubt we would have seen stuff like making Minecraft within Minecraft by now. the player base is so good at being ridiculous with their projects at this point that they could find a Redstone contraption to farm vaults by the next snapshot release.

Regarding your desire to debuff raid farms and buff villager trading, that isn't what we are seeing. I feel that the OP Raid farm is a counterbalance to all the trading necessary for building a proper trading hall with the enchanted book change. Luckily for me, I have villagers that predate the change. As I play on Bedrock, I cannot have the maximum efficiency as i cannot hold my looting sword in my offhand while drinking the potion. Frankly, it feels like Java Edition players acknowledge the overbalancing on their side without realizing the potential effects on their Bedrock counterpart.
If raid farms are an exploit, why did Mojang keep them for 8 significant updates?
In oposition to your D, i thought it would be cool if we could stick the ominous potions in the brewing stand, add pillager mob drop and get a stronger version of the potion.

Not a bad idea. However. What makes you think that mojang would take such an ambitious leap, as to add halberds to minecraft? Don't get me wrong. I have played games like elden ring and dark souls and it was insane and awesome, and halberds are awesome weapons. But they simply don't feel all that minecrafty. Keep the great sword though. I don't know if he would like that you said Canman18. But also, even Mojang can't stand how slow minecarts are! Have you seen the videos released by the Minecraft Channel? They obviously can't stand how slow the carts are because they keep speeding them up. In Minecraft Live, Jeb rode in a 70 block per second Minecart, and in their rare mobs video, they were going more than 8 blocks per second. Mojang, just stop modding your game and just make it vanilla!
Or you could make it so it has a chance for you to keep your armor, depending on it's level.
